comment.author: 74482219@N05
comment._content: Hey there, Just a quick note to say thank you for posting not one but two picture of our business on your flicker account! This one we have not seen before ourselves. Tough we believe it as taken probably of what is now the corridor to the squash courts. Where those boxes are probable where the ladies changing room is now!! In answer to your question about the jars. We have a few on display along with much memorabilia...There are many more still stored in the old stores now covered in a thick layer of dust, which in my opinion just adds to them! We have a facebook page www.facebook.com/DownesBar?ref=ts on which there are some more up to date pictures. Thanks again

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/74482219@N05] You're very welcome! Delighted to hear you're still going strong and carrying on the traditions of Henry Downes. We have more photos of your establishment, including shots of your cellar. And did you know you used to have a Mineral Water Factory? I'll upload one or two over the next while so keep an eye out for them...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 74482219@N05
comment._content: That would be fantastic!!  And yes we did know about the mineral water factory, although I believe that it wasn't mineral water as we currently know it, more fizzy pop!!!  We still have a few of the original advertising signs for this, wrapped in the original paper as they would have come from the printers!  Nothing is ever thrown out here!!!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/74482219@N05] Brilliant! You should put them up on your Facebook page or on your Flickr Stream...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
